answers.answer: She has mild hypothyroidism which may increase cholesterol -- in this case by 5-10%.  Correcting the hypothyroidism is appopriate, but unlikely to reverse the insulin resistance syndrome (diabetes, high triglycerides) -- the key here is weight loss.Some may advocate to treat the hypothyroid AND pursue aggressive lifestyle changes, then repeat lipids/sugar in 3 months and reconsider meds for these issues.
